org.lasarobotics.vision.opmode.extensions

Class ImageRotationExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lasarobotics.vision.opmode.extensions.ImageRotationExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VisionExtension

    public class ImageRotationExtension
extends java.lang.Object
implements VisionExtension
    Implements image rotation correction to ensure the camera is facing the correct direction

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ImageRotationExtension()

      Get rotation compensation as reported by fusing data from the Android sensors and the native Android drawing API.
      double getRotationCompensationAngle()
      Get rotation compensation angle as reported by fusing data from the Android sensors and the native Android drawing API.
      ScreenOrientation getScreenOrientationActual()
      Get the screen orientation as returned by Android sensors Use getRotationCompensationAngle() instead if you want to correct for the screen rotation for purposes such as drawing to the screen.
      ScreenOrientation getScreenOrientationDisplay()
      Get the screen orientation of the current activity This is the native orientation of the display Some rotations, including upside down, are natively disabled in Android

      Do not use this to figure out the current phone orientation as Android can lock the screen orientation and therefore force your program into one orientation.

      Set the zero, or default, orientation for the camera

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageRotationExtension

        public ImageRotationExtension()

    • Method Detail

      • setZeroOrientation

        public void setZeroOrientation(ScreenOrientation zeroOrientation)
        Set the zero, or default, orientation for the camera

        Typically this is LANDSCAPE, but certain phone models may need this set to LANDSCAPE_REVERSE if you are seeing the image as upside down

        Parameters:
        zeroOrientation - Zero, or default, orientation, typically LANDSCAPE

      • enableAutoRotate

        public void enableAutoRotate()
        Enable Auto Rotate in Android settings

        This will revert to system setting on app exit.

      • disableAutoRotate

        public void disableAutoRotate()
        Disable Auto Rotate in Android settings

        This will revert to system setting on app exit.

      • setActivityOrientationAutoRotate

        public void setActivityOrientationAutoRotate()
        Allow the screen to rotate freely

        This will also allow the screen to rotate into a PORTRAIT_REVERSE position which is usually disabled by the Android system. Please use this method even when you want the auto rotate behavior.

      • setActivityOrientationFixed

        public void setActivityOrientationFixed(ScreenOrientation orientation)
        Set a fixed orientation for the app
        Parameters:
        orientation - Fixed screen orientation

      • getScreenOrientationDisplay

        public ScreenOrientation getScreenOrientationDisplay()
        Get the screen orientation of the current activity This is the native orientation of the display Some rotations, including upside down, are natively disabled in Android

        Do not use this to figure out the current phone orientation as Android can lock the screen orientation and therefore force your program into one orientation.

        Returns:
        Screen orientation as reported by the current activity

      • getScreenOrientationActual

        public ScreenOrientation getScreenOrientationActual()
        Get the screen orientation as returned by Android sensors Use getRotationCompensationAngle() instead if you want to correct for the screen rotation for purposes such as drawing to the screen. If all you need is to figure out which way the phone is facing, you can use this method.
        Returns:
        Screen orientation as reported by Android sensors

      • getRotationCompensationAngle

        public double getRotationCompensationAngle()
        Get rotation compensation angle as reported by fusing data from the Android sensors and the native Android drawing API. Use this when you need to figure out which way you need to draw onto the screen.

        This is a compensation between the activity orientation and the actual phone orientation. If you need to get the actual phone orientation alone then use getScreenOrientationActual().

        Returns:
        Fused angle compensating for the difference between the actual orientation and the Android API drawing orientation.

      • getRotationCompensation

        public ScreenOrientation getRotationCompensation()
        Get rotation compensation as reported by fusing data from the Android sensors and the native Android drawing API. Use this when you need to figure out which way you need to draw onto the screen.

        This is a compensation between the activity orientation and the actual phone orientation. If you need to get the actual phone orientation alone then use getScreenOrientationActual().

        Returns:
        Fused orientation compensating for the difference between the actual orientation and the Android API drawing orientation.

      • setIsUsingSecondaryCamera

        public void setIsUsingSecondaryCamera(boolean inverted)
        Set whether the direction of rotation should be inverted. This may be necessary when using the inner camera
        Parameters:
        inverted - True to rotate counterclockwise, false for clockwise

      • isRotationInverted

        public boolean isRotationInverted()
        Returns whether rotation is inverted
        Returns:
        True is rotating counterclockwise, false otherwise
